section.title: Countable and uncountable nouns
section.sectiontitle: We can use countable nouns in the singular or plural.
section.sectiontitle2: Uncountable nouns do not have a plural.

section.title: There is and There are: positive and negative forms
section.sectiontitle: We use There is a/an with singular nouns and There are with plural nouns. We usually use the short form There's.
section.text1: There is a cup on the table.
section.sectiontitle2: In the negative, we use There is not and There are not.  We usually use the short forms.

section.title: There is and There are: question form
section.sectiontitle: In the question, we use Is there? and Are there?
section.text1: There's a swimming pool near here.
section.text1a: Is there a swimming pool near here? Yes, there is.
section.text2: There aren't a lot of people in your family.
section.text2a: Are there a lot of people in your family? No, there aren't.
